intro: Goniostachyum graveolens, commonly known as the fragrant goniostachyum, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Arecaceae family, which includes palms, and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and pinnate leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often emitting a sweet scent. It is typically found in moist, well-drained soils in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
